main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted by several observers in Washington, D.C. on 6 February 1959.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes., The object was described as a small, bright light, the size of a star., The object remained stationary in the sky and made no sound., It was estimated to be at an altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet., Numerous attempts were made to track the object using binoculars and telescopes.
sighted object: small, bright light in the sky
